revision.text:
The '''AGEUS Award for Individual Contribution''' began in 2006. It is presented annually during the meeting of the [[Annual Georgia European Union Summit]], and goes to an individual who has shown exceptional success and dedication in fostering foreign economic development in the State of [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], USA. [[Image:AGEUS International Award 2007.jpg|200px|thumb|AGEUS International Award 2007]]
== Prior AGEUS Award winners == *2006: Christopher N. Smith, [[Honorary Consul]] of the Kingdom of [[Denmark]] to Georgia, for his work bringing Danish companies to Georgia. *2007: James Blair of the [[Georgia Department of Economic Development]] for his 19 years of ongoing work in Europe on behalf of Georgia business. *2008: Not awarded *2009: Dr. Bruce S. Allen for his work in foreign relations and economic development. *2010: Not awarded
== References == *[http://stories.globalatlanta.com/2007stories/015591.html Global Atlanta article]{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}
[[Category:Awards established in 2006]] [[Category:Economic development awards]]

revision.text:
{{Use British English|date=May 2013}} In the United Kingdom, [[Association football|football]] clubs sometimes choose to enter [[Administration (law)|administration]] when they are unable to pay off outstanding [[debt]]s. Under the [[Insolvency Act 1986]], a business will face a winding-up order bringing them to court and if it is shown that a business cannot pay debts as they fall due or cannot repay outstanding debts then the company will be classified as [[UK insolvency law#Definition|insolvent]].{{cite web|url=http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1986/45/section/123|title=Insolvency Act 1986 (c. 45) – Part IV Winding Up of Companies Registered under the Companies Acts – Chapter VI Winding Up by the Court – Grounds and effect of winding-up petition|work=[[UK Statute Law Database]]|publisher=[[Office of Public Sector Information]]|accessdate=13 October 2013}} '''Administration''' puts accountants "in charge of pretty much everything apart from coaching the players and picking the team". For a football club in administration, the "football creditors rule" requires football-related debts such as wages owed to players and staff, and transfer fees owed to other clubs to be paid first.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/7741859.stm|title=Football clubs owe tax millions |last=Grant|first=Paul|date=23 November 2008|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=26 February 2010}} ==England and Wales== In 2000, [[ITV Digital]] bought the broadcasting rights to [[The Football League|Football League]] and [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] matches in a three-year, £315m deal.{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-110973/Fears-soccer-clubs-ITV-Digital-sale.html|title=Fears for soccer clubs as ITV Digital is put up for sale|work=[[The Daily Mail]]|accessdate=14 March 2010|location=London}} In March 2002, the company went bankrupt owing the League £180 million which it said it "cannot afford to pay".{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/1896732.stm|title=ITV Digital goes broke|date=27 March 2002|publisher=[[BBC News]]|accessdate=14 March 2010}} As a result of this many Football League clubs had financial problems and entered administration.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/1898021.stm|title=ITV Digital woes bring football crisis|date=28 March 2002|publisher=[[BBC News]]|accessdate=14 March 2010}}{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2002/oct/22/newsstory.sport|title= Crisis clubs|date=22 October 2002|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=13 October 2013 | location=London}} Before the implementation of a points deduction it was perceived that clubs had "manipulated and abused [administration] as a way of shedding debts then restructuring, and borrowing again once the hapless creditors had been fobbed off with their 8p in the pound".{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/7305998.stm|title= Football administration|last=Farquhar|first=Gordon|date=20 March 2008|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=26 February 2010}} In September 2003, it was proposed that clubs entering administration would be docked 10 points. A [[Fit and proper person test|'fit and proper persons' test]] was also introduced in an attempt to prevent fraudulent activities. If a person was previously director at a club which was in "administration twice during a five-year period" or at "two different clubs that have each gone into administration in a five-year period" then they would be prevented from becoming the controlling shareholder of a [[Football League]] club.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/5030910.stm|title= The murky world of football finances|last=Summers|first=Chris|date=28 June 2006|publisher=[[BBC News]]|accessdate=13 March 2010}} A 'fit and proper persons' test was also introduced for directors of [[Premier League]] clubs.{{cite web|url=http://www.premierleague.com/staticFiles/12/66/0,,12306~91666,00.pdf#page=17 |title=The F.A. Premier League: Charter Report 2004/05 |publisher=[[Premier League]] |accessdate=13 October 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110818150113/http://www.premierleague.com/staticFiles/12/66/0%2C%2C12306~91666%2C00.pdf |archivedate=18 August 2011 }} In November 2009, [[Stephen Vaughan, Sr.]] became the first director to fail the 'fit and proper persons' test.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2009/nov/18/chester-city-fit-proper-person-test|title=Chester City chief becomes first owner to fail fit and proper person test|last= Conn|first=David|date=18 November 2009|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=13 October 2013 | location=London}} To ease financial problems for clubs that had been relegated, "parachute payments" were introduced to give time to adapt to the financial gulf between divisions.{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/points-threat-to-clubs-choosing-administration-580968.html|title=Points threat to clubs choosing administration|last=Warshaw|first=Andrew|date=24 September 2003|work=[[The Independent]]|accessdate=26 February 2010 | location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100409015315/http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/points-threat-to-clubs-choosing-administration-580968.html| archivedate= 9 April 2010 | deadurl= no}} The deductions of 10 points in the [[Football League]] and 9 points in the [[Premier League]] were ratified in 2004, with the rule in place from the start of the 2004–05 season.{{cite web|url=http://breaking.tcm.ie/archives/2004/0115/sport/chairmen-to-agree-points-deductions-129765.html|title=Chairmen to agree points deductions|date=15 January 2004|work=[[BreakingNews.ie]]|publisher=[[Thomas Crosbie Holdings]]|accessdate=26 February 2010}}{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2004/jan/30/newsstory.sport14|title=Crisis clubs will lose nine points|last=Chaudhary|first=Vivek|date=20 January 2004|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=13 October 2013 | location=London}} The League also adopted rules that prevented any side from being in administration for either two successive seasons or eighteen consecutive months. The reason for the deduction being a point less in the Premier League was that the teams play eight fewer fixtures than Football League clubs. The first club to incur this new penalty were [[League One]] side [[Wrexham F.C.]] who entered administration on 3 December 2004.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/wales/4064257.stm|title= Wrexham FC in administration|date=3 December 2004|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=26 February 2010}} [[Leeds United A.F.C.|Leeds United]] filed for administration with only a few days remaining in the [[2006–07 Football League Championship|2006–07 season]], which automatically triggered a 10-point penalty. This placed Leeds at the bottom of the table and relegated the club, but they were extremely likely to have been relegated anyway. By entering administration during the 2006–07 season, they hoped to avoid starting the [[2007–08 Football League#League One|2007–08 season]] on −10 points. The following week, [[Boston United F.C.|Boston United]] entered administration in the final minutes of a defeat to [[Wrexham A.F.C.|Wrexham]] which ensured they were relegated to the [[Football Conference]], meaning they likewise avoided starting the following season on -10 points (though they would find themselves being double-relegated to the Conference North for unrelated reasons).[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/b/boston_united/6738469.stm Boston suffer new demotion blow] The Football League saw both cases as clubs trying to exploit a loophole, and changed the rules. From 2007–08, any club entering administration after the fourth Thursday in March would have their 10-point deduction suspended until the following season. If the club is relegated the points will be deducted from their tally at the start of next season. If the club stays up the 10 points will be taken off their final total. {{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/6736997.stm|title=League closes 10-point loophole |date=9 June 2007|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=26 February 2010}} On 26 February 2010, [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] became the first Premier League club to enter administration. ===Football creditors rule=== In a situation of insolvency, the "football creditors rule" means that debts to other clubs or players are prioritised and must be paid in full before the club is eligible to compete again in the league.{{cite web|last=Plainer|first=Adam|title=Paying by the rules|url=http://www.thelawyer.com/paying-by-the-rules/1003055.article|work=[[The Lawyer]]|accessdate=31 May 2010|date=11 January 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100512172003/http://www.thelawyer.com/paying-by-the-rules/1003055.article| archivedate= 12 May 2010 | deadurl= no}} The [[Enterprise Act 2002]] made reforms to the insolvency act and, from 15 September 2003, the altered procedures for administration were implemented.{{cite web|title=Frequently Asked Questions about the Enterprise Act: Company|url=http://www.insolvency.gov.uk/faq/faqeactc.htm|publisher=[[Insolvency Service|The Insolvency Service]]|accessdate=31 May 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100505053545/http://www.insolvency.gov.uk/faq/faqeactc.htm| archivedate= 5 May 2010 | deadurl= no}} Most notably it abolished the Crown's preferential right to recover unpaid taxes ahead of other creditors.{{cite web|title=Enterprise Act changes to be introduced in June|url=http://www.out-law.com/page-3501|date=24 April 2003|work=[[OUT-LAW]]|accessdate=31 May 2010}} As such, [[HM Revenue and Customs]] (HMRC) is now often not paid in full (between 2003 and 2010, outstanding unpaid taxes to the HMRC amounted to £30 million).{{cite news|title=Crunched creditors call time on living the dream|first=Dave|last=Conn|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/david-conn-inside-sport-blog/2010/feb/10/portsmouth-cardiff-hmrc-winding-up|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=10 February 2010|accessdate=13 October 2013|location=London}} This legality of the football creditors rule was challenged in 2004 in ''[[Inland Revenue Commissioners v The Wimbledon Football Club Ltd]]''. However, it was found that "full payment to football creditors (out of third party funds) ahead of preferential creditors did not infringe the provisions of section s4(4)(a) of the Act" and "differential treatment may be necessary to secure the continuation of the company's business and may be regarded as supportable".{{cite web|title=Company Voluntary Arrangements |first=John |last=Verrill |url=http://www.dundas-wilson.com/publications/dw_cms_4894.pdf |publisher=[[Dundas & Wilson]] |date=1 September 2008 |accessdate=31 May 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002071144/http://www.dundas-wilson.com/publications/dw_cms_4894.pdf |archivedate=2 October 2011 }} In 2011 HMRC brought another challenge to the football creditors rule in the High Court, this time on the basis that it breached fundamental principles of insolvency law, including the [[pari passu]] rule that all unsecured creditors should be paid on a proportionate basis. However, in May 2012 the court rejected the challenge as it found that the rule was not a deliberate evasion of insolvency law.{{cite news|title=HM Revenue and Customs v The Football League Ltd [2012] EWHC 1372 (Ch)|url=http://www.bailii.org/ew/cases/EWHC/Ch/2012/1372.html}} ===List of clubs that have entered administration=== {{Expand list|date=February 2011}} {{update-section|date=March 2017}} {| class="wikitable sortable" !Club !Entered
administration !Exited

[[Football League One|League One]] |−{{nts|10}} pts{{cite web|title=Coventry City deducted 10 points by the Football League|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21970140|accessdate=28 March 2013 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=28 March 2013}}
−10 pts{{cite news|title=Coventry City: Football League docks Sky Blues 10 points|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23548760|date=2 August 2013}}
|- |[[Aldershot Town F.C.|Aldershot Town]] |{{dts|2013|May|02|format=dmy}}{{cite web|title=Relegated club goes into administration|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22383276|accessdate=2 May 2013 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=2 March 2013}} | |[[Football League Two|League Two]] | |} ==Scotland== Following the adoption of a points sanction in the [[The Football League|English Football League]], a similar rule was proposed for adoption by the [[Scottish Premier League]] (SPL) in December 2003.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/3331583.stm|title=SPL debate administration penalty |date=18 December 2003|publisher=BBC |work=BBC Sport|accessdate=1 March 2010}} It was announced in January 2004 that SPL clubs going into administration in the [[2004–05 Scottish Premier League|2004–05 season]] would be subject to a 10-point deduction and be prevented from signing new players. With [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]] and [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]] already in administration at the time, it was decided that if "they are not in the process of coming out of administration by 31 May", the deduction would be applied at the start of the following season.{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/3418773.stm|title=Dundee face point deduction|date=22 January 2004|publisher=BBC |work=BBC Sport|accessdate=1 March 2010}} Furthermore, the [[Scottish Football Association]] would not allow clubs in administration to play in European competition.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/3415935.stm |title=Uefa blow for cash-strapped clubs |date=21 January 2004 |publisher=BBC |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 March 2010}} Both Motherwell and Dundee met the required conditions to avoid the deduction of points.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/d/dundee/3749583.stm |title=Dundee rescue plan agreed |date=26 May 2004 |publisher=BBC |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 March 2010}} The 10 point penalty was subsequently applied to [[Gretna F.C.|Gretna]] in the 2007–08 season and [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] in 2011–12. Although the [[Scottish Football League]] (SFL) had no automatic deduction of points for clubs going into administration, it reserved the right to "deduct championship points before or during a season and/or to impose a player registration embargo on any club".{{cite book|title=Scottish Football League Handbook 2009–2010|publisher=[[Scottish Football League]]|pages=148|chapter=Constitution and Rules |url=http://www.scottishfootballleague.com/res/documents/SFL/SFLHandbook/SFL%20Constitution%20and%20Rules2.pdf}} This meant that its penalties for insolvency varied; [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]] were docked 25 points in the 2010–11 season because it was the second time they had entered administration in a relatively short period.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/scottish-football/10365208/SPFL-clubs-that-go-into-administration-could-be-relegated.html |title=SPFL clubs that go into administration could be relegated |first=Ewing |last=Grahame |work=Daily Telegraph |publisher=Telegraph Media Group |date=9 October 2013 |accessdate=18 December 2013}} The SFL also had the power to place a team in the bottom tier ([[Scottish Football League Third Division|Third Division]]) if there were any doubts that the club could fulfill their fixtures for the forthcoming season.{{cite web |title=Livi relegated to Division Three |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/l/livingston/8179998.stm |publisher=BBC |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=8 November 2011 |date=5 August 2009}} The [[administration and liquidation of The Rangers Football Club Plc]] prompted much discussion in Scotland about what sanctions (if any) are appropriate for an insolvent club.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17975013 |title=SPL board can't win over Rangers decision - Stephen Thompson |date=6 May 2012 |accessdate=18 December 2013 |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC}} When Rangers entered administration in February 2012, the club was docked 10 points in the [[2011–12 Scottish Premier League]]. The SPL clubs agreed to amend the penalty for administration to the greater of 10 points or one third of the club's tally in the previous season.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18263819 |title=SPL: Clubs set new financial fair play rules at Hampden meeting |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=30 May 2012 |accessdate=18 December 2013}} Rangers attempted to agree a CVA with its creditors, but this offer was rejected by HMRC in June 2012.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18407309 |title=Rangers to re-form after creditors' deal is rejected |first1=Alasdair |last1=Lamont |first2=Chris |last2=McLaughlin |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=12 June 2012 |accessdate=18 December 2013}} The business and assets of Rangers were instead sold to a new company. One of Rangers' assets was its membership of the SPL, but this could not be transferred without the approval of the other SPL clubs. Rangers' application for transfer was rejected by a 10–1 majority.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18703183 |title=Rangers newco refused SPL entry after chairmen vote |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=4 July 2012 |accessdate=18 December 2013}} The SPL attempted to negotiate a deal with the SFL whereby Rangers would enter the First Division (second tier). This was rejected by SFL clubs, who instead voted for Rangers to be granted associate membership of the SFL and a place in the Third Division (fourth tier).{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18813407 |title=Rangers: Charles Green accepts Division Three vote |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=13 July 2012 |accessdate=18 December 2013}} When the SPL and SFL merged to form the [[Scottish Professional Football League]] (SPFL) in 2013, the penalty for entering administration was standardised as 15 points. [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]] entered administration days before the leagues merged and were docked 15 points for the 2013–14 season under the old SPL rules, as they had earned 44 points in the 2012–13 season.{{cite web |url=http://sport.stv.tv/football/clubs/hearts/229830-qa-what-will-happen-to-hearts-now-they-are-in-administration/ |title=Q&A: What will happen to Hearts now they are in administration? |first=Grant |last=Russell |work=STV Sport |publisher=STV |date=19 June 2013 |accessdate=18 December 2013}} ===List of clubs that have entered administration=== {{Expand list|date=February 2011}} {| class="wikitable sortable" !Club !Entered

revision.comment: Robot - Removing category Jewish businesspeople who died in the Holocaust per [[WP:CFD|CFD]] at [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2018 October 12]].
revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Alfred Müller | image = | imagesize = | birth_date = 1888 | birth_place = [[Zagreb]], [[Austria-Hungary|Austro-Hungarian Empire]], (now [[Croatia]]) | death_date = 1945 (aged 57) | death_place = [[Dachau concentration camp]] | death_cause = Murdered in [[Holocaust]] | relations = [[Adolf Müller (industrialist)|Adolf Müller]]
(father)
[[Leo Müller]]
(brother) | spouse = Klara ([[Married and maiden names|née]] Hafner) Müller (Miler) | children = Alan
(son)
Evelina
(daughter) | nationality = [[Croats|Croat]] }} '''Alfred Müller''' (from 1938 '''Miler'''; 1888 – 1945) was [[Croatia]]n entrepreneur and oldest son of [[Adolf Müller (industrialist)|Adolf Müller]].{{harvtxt|Snješka Knežević|2011|p=55}} Müller was born in [[Zagreb]] to a wealthy [[Jew]]ish family, with younger brother Leo. He graduated from higher technical school in [[Vienna]]. Müller was married to Klara ([[Married and maiden names|née]] Hafner) with whom he had two children, son Alan and daughter Evelina. After his father death, Müller inherited "Balkan" cinema and part of residential-commercial complex in Varšavska and Masarykova Street. In 1938, because of the political situation and [[antisemitism]] caused by [[Nazi propaganda]], Müller and his family converted to [[Catholicism]] and change their surname to Miler.{{harvtxt|Ognjen Kraus|1998|p=17}} In 1939, Müller sold the residential-commercial complex in Varšavska and Masarykova Street to a Topić family from Zagreb. That same year Müller and his family moved to [[France]]. During [[World War II]], Müller and his wife where arrested by [[Gestapo]] in France with the help from [[Vichy France|Vichy Regime]], while their daughter managed to save herself by hiding at friends. Müller son joined the [[French Resistance]]. In August 1944, Müller was deported to [[Dachau concentration camp]], where in January 1945 he was killed. Müller family survived the [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]], his wife and daughter moved to [[United States]] after the war, and in 1949 his son returned and stayed in Zagreb where he still lives. With the [[independence of Croatia]] in 1991, Müller son sought the return of the property which was taken from his father by [[Ustaše]] and later the communist of [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia]].{{cite news|url=http://www.jutarnji.hr/m-llerovi---povijest-jedne-zagrebacke-obitelji/188361/ |title=Müllerovi - Povijest jedne zagrebačke obitelji |publisher=[[Jutarnji list]] |date=2008-04-20 |language=Croatian |archivedate=7 March 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160307023630/http://www.jutarnji.hr/m-llerovi---povijest-jedne-zagrebacke-obitelji/188361/ |df= }}{{cite news|url=http://www.zagrebonline.hr/darujemo-prvi-hrvatski-zvucni-film-lisinski/|title=Darujemo prvi hrvatski zvučni film "Lisinski"|publisher=www.zagreb.hr|date=2011-06-27|language=Croatian}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Bibliography== {{Refbegin|30em}} * {{cite book|last=Snješka Knežević|first=Aleksander Laslo|title=Židovski Zagreb|year=2011|publisher=AGM, Židovska općina Zagreb|location=Zagreb|isbn=978-953-174-393-8|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|last=Kraus|first=Ognjen|title=Dva stoljeća povijesti i kulture Židova u Zagrebu i Hrvatskoj|year=1998|publisher=Židovska općina Zagreb|location=Zagreb|isbn=953-96836-2-9|ref=harv}} {{refend}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Müller, Alfred}} [[Category:1888 births]] [[Category:1945 deaths]] [[Category:People from Zagreb]] [[Category:Croatian Jewish people who died in the Holocaust]] [[Category:Austro-Hungarian Jews]] [[Category:Croatian Austro-Hungarians]] [[Category:Converts to Roman Catholicism from Judaism]] [[Category:Croatian businesspeople]] [[Category:Croatian civilians killed in World War II]] [[Category:Croatian people who died in Dachau concentration camp]]

[[Mark Getty]] (cousin) | box_width = }} '''Andrew Rork Getty''' (July 1, 1967[http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/sfgate/obituary.aspx?pid=174591961 Legacy Obituries]– March 31, 2015) was an American oil heir, businessman, film director and philanthropist. ==Early life== Andrew Rork Getty{{cite news|last1=Fontevecchia|first1=Agustino|title=Andrew Rork Getty Found Dead In Potential Homicide As The Getty Family Tragedy Continues|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/afontevecchia/2015/03/31/andrew-rork-getty-found-dead-in-potential-homicide-as-the-getty-family-tragedy-continues/|accessdate=3 April 2015|work=Forbes|date=31 March 2015}} was born in 1967{{cite book|title=California|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jd0jAQAAIAAJ|date=July 1990|publisher=New West Communications Corporation|page=101}} in [[San Francisco, California]].[https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2015/apr/01/grandson-of-getty-oil-founder-discovered-dead-in-home Andrew Getty, grandson of Getty Oil founder, found dead], ''[[The Guardian]]'', 1 April 2015Brooks Barnes, Michael Cieply, [https://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/02/us/gettys-again-made-to-cope-with-grief-in-public-eye.html?_r=0 Gettys Again Made to Cope With Grief in Public Eye], ''[[The New York Times]]'', April 1, 2015 His father, [[Gordon Getty]], is an heir and classical music composer.Justin William Moyer, [https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2015/03/31/andrew-getty-getty-family-heir-found-dead/ Andrew Getty, 47, dead in latest Getty family tragedy], ''[[The Washington Post]]'', April 1, 2015 His mother, Ann Gilbert Getty, is a philanthropist. His paternal grandfather, [[J. Paul Getty]], was the founder of the Getty Oil Company.Kate Mather, Richard Winton, [http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-j-paul-gettys-grandson-found-dead-lapd-investigating-20150331-story.html Getty oil heir had serious medical condition, court documents say], ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'', April 1, 2015[https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-32141609 Andrew Getty found dead in LA home], ''[[BBC]]'', 1 April 2015 Getty was educated at [[Town School for Boys]] in San Francisco and the [[Dunn School, Los Olivos|Dunn School]], a prep school in California.Ashley Collman, [http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3020687/Oil-heir-Andrew-Getty-dead-bathroom-47-year-old-s-troubled-ex-girlfriend-detained.html Dead oil heir Andrew Getty had serious medical condition made worse by stress caused by ex-girlfriend who discovered his body], ''[[Daily Mail]]'', 1 April 2015 He then attended the [[University of Southern California]] and [[New York University]]. ==Career== Getty was the President of A. Rork Investment Inc., an investment vehicle. He was the manager of Rork Productions, a production company. In 2002, Getty started filming ''[[The Storyteller (film)|The Storyteller]]'' starring [[Frederick Koehler]], [[Sean Patrick Flanery]], [[Brianna Brown]], [[Dina Meyer]] and others. The film was eventually released under the title ''[[The Evil Within (2017 film)|The Evil Within]]'' in 2017, 15 years after the project started and two years after Getty's death.{{cite news |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/late-getty-heirs-directorial-debt-evil-lands-15-years-983388 |title=Late Getty Heir's Directorial Debut 'The Evil Within' Lands After 15 Years |date= 6 March 2017 |first= Alex |last= Ritman |work=Hollywood Reporter }} ==Philanthropy== Getty made charitable contributions to the [[paleontology]] department of the [[Natural History Museum of Los Angeles County]]. ==Personal life== Getty resided in a historic mansion formerly owned by composer [[Miklós Rózsa]] on Montcalm Avenue in the [[Hollywood Hills]]. He was a recluse. Two weeks prior to his death, he filed a restraining order against his ex-girlfriend Lanessa DeJonge. ==Death== Getty died at 47 on March 31, 2015. His body was found by his ex-girlfriend, Lanessa DeJonge. An [[ulcer]] was suspected in the [[Lower gastrointestinal bleeding|intestinal bleeding]] that killed him.{{cite web|last1=TMZ staff|title=J. Paul Getty Grandson: Massive Blood Loss Before Death, Ulcer Suspected|url=http://www.tmz.com/2015/04/04/andrew-getty-death-cause-ulcer-bleeding-rectal-coroner/|website=TMZ.com|accessdate=6 May 2015}} His personal assistant said Getty had complained of stomach pain in the two months beforehand. The Los Angeles county coroner ruled the death accidental, with [[methamphetamine]] use and [[heart disease]] as contributing factors.{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2015/jun/17/andrew-getty-died-of-haemorrhage-ulcer-bad-heart-and-meth-official |title=Andrew Getty died of haemorrhage, ulcer, bad heart and meth – coroner |agency=Reuters |date=17 June 2015 |website=The Guardian |publisher=[[Guardian Media Group]] |access-date=15 March 2017}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Getty, Andrew}} [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:2015 deaths]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Los Angeles]] [[Category:Philanthropists from California]] [[Category:Getty family|Andrew]] [[Category:University of Southern California alumni]] [[Category:New York University alumni]] [[Category:Film directors from Los Angeles]] [[Category:Film directors from San Francisco]]

[[File:aureliomartins-1.jpg|thumb|150px|right|Aurélio Martins]] '''Aurélio Pires Quaresma Martins''' (born November 24, 1966) is a [[São Tomé]]an journalist, businessman and politician, who until May 2018 was leader of the [[Movement for the Liberation of São Tomé and Príncipe/Social Democratic Party]] (MLSTP/PSD).
== Journalist and businessman == Martins started his career as a journalist at São Tomé and Príncipe's National Radio (Rádio Nacional) between 1984 and 1985, and later worked at Angola's National Radio (RNA) from 1999 to 2007. He is the head of construction and security company Gibela Group<ref name="telan01" /> and president of FAMA (Aurélio Martins' Foundation).<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.telanon.info/sociedade/2010/06/01/4235/parceria-entre-a-fundacao-aurelio-martins-e-a-camara-de-maia-portugal-poe-sorriso-no-rosto-das-criancas/ |title=Téla Nón: Parceria entre a Fundação Aurélio Martins e a Cámara de Maia-Portugal |first= |last= |work=telanon.info |year=2010 |accessdate=1 June 2010}}</ref><ref name="angop01">{{cite web |url=http://www.portalangop.co.ao/motix/pt_pt/noticias/sociedade/2010/2/9/Fundacao-Aurelio-Martins-FESA-perspectivam-acordo-parceria,0b6d3672-5b9e-48a1-a039-ba30bdeddd09.html |title=Angop: Fundação Aurélio Martins e FESA perspectivam acordo de parceria |first= |last= |work=portalangop.co.ao |year=2010 |accessdate=4 January 2010}}</ref>
== Political career == Martins was elected to the [[National Assembly of São Tomé and Príncipe]] for the [[Lobata District]] in the [[São Toméan legislative election, 2010|2010 legislative election]] and afterwards became president of the Humans Rights, Citizenship and Gender Commission in the National Assembly.
He was elected President of the MLSTP/PSD on the party's ordinary congress in January 2011.<ref name="bbc01" />
Aurélio Martins was his party's candidate in the [[São Toméan presidential election, 2011|2011 presidential election]],<ref name="telan01">{{cite web |url= http://www.telanon.info/politica/2011/01/17/6080/aurelio-martins-eleito-novo-lider-do-mlstppsd/ |title=Téla Nón: Aurélio Martins eleito novo líder do MLSTP/PSD |first= |last= |work=telanon.info |year=2011 |accessdate=9 June 2011}}</ref><ref name="bbc01">{{cite web |url= http://www.bbc.co.uk/portugueseafrica/news/story/2011/01/110117_mlstpnewpresidentbp.shtml |title=BBCParaAfrica.com: Aurélio Martins eleito presidente do MLSTP-PSD |first= |last= |work=bbc.co.uk |year=2011 |accessdate=9 June 2011}}</ref> but got only 4.06% of the votes and lost to former and MLSTP leader [[Manuel Pinto da Costa]].
== Downfall == He was suspended from the party in mid-May 2018 due to backing the government's dismissal of three supreme court justices (incl. the court's president) who had ruled in favour of handing over the [[Rosema Brewery]] in [[Neves, São Tomé and Príncipe|Neves]] - controlled by the party's largest donor Antonio Monteiros and his brother Domingos Monteiros, who were both MPs for the party - to an Angolan businessman.<ref>https://presidential-power.com/?cat=250</ref> He was replaced as party president with [[Jorge Bom Jesus]] at an extraordinary congress on 30 June.<ref>https://stpdigital.net/2018/07/01/elege-o-novo-presidente-do-mlstp-psd/</ref>
== Honours == Martins was elected Figura do Ano (“São Toméan of the Year”) in 2007, 2008 and 2009.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.telanon.info/sociedade/2009/01/09/835/aurelio-martins-eleito-figura-do-ano-2008-em-sao-tome-e-principe/ |title=Téla Nón: Aurélio Martins eleito figura do ano 2008 em São Tomé e Príncipe |first= |last= |work=telanon.info |year=2011 |accessdate=8 June 2011}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

{{About|the Swiss chemical company|the World War II German aircraft company|Bachem Werke GmbH}} {{Infobox company | name = Bachem Holding AG | logo = Bachem logo slogan rgb blue.jpg | logo_size = 200px | type = [[Joint-stock company|Stock company]] | traded_as = {{SWX|BANB}} | foundation = 1971 | location = [[Bubendorf]], [[Switzerland]] | key_people = Thomas Früh <small>([[Chief Executive Officer|CEO]])</small>, Kuno Sommer <small>([[Chairman of the Board of Directors]])</small> | industry = [[Chemical industry|Chemicals]], [[biotechnology]] | products = [[Biopharmaceutical]]s, [[organic chemistry|organic]] and [[fine chemicals]], [[chemical synthesis]] equipment, custom manufacturing of chemicals and related products | homepage = [http://www.bachem.com www.bachem.com] }} '''Bachem''' is a contract manufacturing organization headquartered in [[Bubendorf]], Switzerland.<ref name=bloomberg>{{cite web|title=Company Overview of Bachem Holding AG|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=760034|publisher=Bloomberg|access-date=20 June 2018}}</ref>
Bachem specializes in the manufacturing of [[peptides]] and complex organic molecules such as [[active pharmaceutical ingredients]]. In addition, biochemicals for research purposes and manufacturing processes are developed. The firm provides a number of products and services to the pharmaceutical and [[biology|life science]] industries, including [[organic chemistry|organic]], [[fine chemicals|fine]] and performance chemicals, custom manufacturing of [[biopharmaceutical]]s, [[chemical synthesis]] capabilities and new chemical entities, and services for the [[bioscience]] sector.<ref name=bloomberg />
==History<ref>{{cite web|title=Bachem - History|url=http://www.bachem.com/company/history/|publisher=Bachem}}</ref> == In 1971, Peter Grogg founded Bachem Feinchemikalien AG with two employees in Liestal near Basel with the focus on peptide synthesis. In 1977, Bachem moved with eight employees to nearby Bubendorf, and, in 1978, it manufactured, for the first time, peptides for use in medicine under cGMP guidelines. Between 1981 and 1991 Bachem tripled its production capacity and built an administration building, and in 1995, facilities were further expanded including the quality control department to a total of 168'000 sq. ft. (15'600 m2).
Expansion into markets outside Europe began with the establishment of Bachem Bioscience, Inc. in Philadelphia, USA in 1987. To strengthen its presence in Europe, Bachem opened sales and marketing centers in Germany in 1988 and in France in 1993. In 1996 it acquired its largest competitor, Bachem, Inc., together with its subsidiaries in Germany and the United Kingdom. In June 1998, following a very successful IPO, Bachem's shares began to be publicly traded on the Swiss Stock Exchange. In 1999 and 2000, a new administration building and a further production facility were respectively opened at the Bubendorf site.
With the acquisition of the San Carlos, California based Peninsula Laboratories, Inc. and its affiliate Peninsula Laboratories Ltd., United Kingdom in December 1999, Bachem extended its strong position in therapeutically active peptides into immunology, a domain with strong future promise. In August 2000, Peninsula Laboratories Europe Ltd. and Bachem (UK) Ltd. merged to a single Bachem group affiliated company in the United Kingdom. The acquisition of Sochinaz SA, a Swiss-based specialized manufacturer of active pharmaceutical ingredients in 2001, strengthened Bachem's expertise and once again expanded its manufacturing capabilities.
Reorganization of distribution was carried out in Germany and France as a result of the positive experiences gained with the realignment of the sales and marketing organization in the USA. As a result the subsidiary in France was closed at the end of 2002. The subsidiary in Germany was relocated from Heidelberg to Weil am Rhein, was renamed Bachem Distribution Services GmbH and is now responsible for all customers in the European Union. In 2003, a holding structure was introduced to align the factual organization of the company with an appropriate legal structure and to support management structure adjustments, given by continued company growth requirements. In 2007, Bachem acquired the Clinalfa® brand for Bachem's ready-to-use clinical trial materials and related services. In 2010, Bachem commenced the partnership with Atheris laboratories offering the Melusine® range of research products for lead generation of new pharmaceutical candidates. In 2011, Bachem celebrated its 40th year as a producer of research ingredients and active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs) for the pharmaceutical industry.
In 2013, Bachem and GlyTech Inc. teamed up to offer [[glycosylated]] peptides in their product pipelines. Bachem and affiliate were conducting groundbreaking work on [[interferon beta-1a]] and to manufacture glycosylated [[somatostatin]] analogues by chemical synthesis.<ref> [http://www.glytech.jp/en/ Glytech Inc. News & Topics]. Retrieved 19 July 2017.</ref>
in 2015, Bachem acquired American Peptide Company, a mid-sized biotech establishment in [[Sunnyvale]] CA, not far from Bachem's US facility in Torrance, expanding the firm's GMP manufacturing and R&D capabilities for the US and international markets.<ref> R.Mullin (2015). [http://cen.acs.org/articles/93/i17/Peptide-Manufacturers-Stake-Positions.html?type=paidArticleContent "Peptide Manufacturers Stake Out Their Positions"]''c&en''. vol. 93 Issue 17 pp. 16-19. April 27 2015. Retrieved 19 July 2017.</ref>
== Divisions == Bachem Holding AG consists of the following divisions:<ref>http://www.bachem.com/company/locations/</ref> * Bachem AG, in Bubendorf, Switzerland * Bachem SA, in Vionnaz, Switzerland * Bachem Americas, Inc., in Torrance, USA * Bachem Americas, Inc., in Vista, USA * Peninsula Laboratories, LLC, in San Carlos, USA * Bachem Distribution Services GmbH, in Weil am Rhein, Germany * Bachem (UK) Ltd., in St. Helens, Great Britain
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * {{official website|http://www.bachem.com/}}
[[Category:Chemical companies of Switzerland]] [[Category:Biotechnology companies established in 1971]] [[Category:Biotechnology companies]] [[Category:Biotechnology companies of Switzerland]] [[Category:Life sciences industry]]

In June 1989, as Poland turned away from communism, a group of British-Polish students and graduates, Polish expats and British businessmen, established ‘Interes’, an organisation promoting business, trade and investment between Britain and Poland.
Under the Chairmanship of Leszek Jakubowski who took over from Barbara Stachowiak in 1993, Interes and the Polish Enterprise Centre were transformed into the British Polish Chamber of Commerce (BPCC), a non-profit organization incorporated in the UK in 1995 as a company limited by guarantee, with Juliusz Bogacki as its Chief Executive. In 1997 the BPCC moved to the Ognisko Polskie on Exhibition Road, where it continued to promote bilateral trade and investment between Britain and Poland, running conferences, workshops, trade missions, business clinics and its regular monthly Open Forum meetings, as well as publish ‘Eagle Eye’, the Chamber magazine.
In 1998/9 the British Polish Chamber of Commerce (BPCC) amalgamated with its sister organisation the British Chamber of Commerce in Poland (BCCP) to form one bilateral organisation.
The British Chamber of Commerce in Poland (BCCP) was established in 1992 as a [[non-profit organization]] incorporated in the UK as a [[company limited by guarantee]]. Its original role was to support British companies investing in the Polish market, shortly after the country's economic transformation. In 2001, the Chamber changed its name and its statute to become a bilateral chamber, supporting two-way trade and investment relations between the [[United Kingdom]] and [[Poland]].
The Chamber's regular events in Poland include business mixers, conferences, seminars and workshops aimed at the international business community and at Polish exporters interested in the UK market. Shortly before Poland joined the EU on 1 May, 2004, the BPCC began holding regular events in London, looking at various aspects of doing business in Poland. After Poland's EU Accession, the BPCC began organising regular recruitment fairs, matching UK companies and employment agencies with Polish workers seeking to work in the UK. These have been held around Poland and in London. Since February 2007, the BPCC has been holding events in London, the Midlands, the North and Scotland aimed at Polish entrepreneurs that have set up businesses in the UK.
Since July 2013, the Chamber has been engaged on a joint project with [[UK Trade and Investment]] as part of the UK Government's Overseas Business Network initiative to support UK exporters. A separate team was recruited to identify Polish importers, distributors, wholesalers and agents and match them with potential UK exporters.
Since October 2014, the Chamber has mirrored the trade project to offer similar support to Polish exporters, identifying for them UK importers, distributors, wholesalers and agents, matched to a Sourcing From Poland service for UK importers.
==Officers== The present Chief Executive Officer is Paweł Siwecki, who replaced Joe Tunney in December 2012. Martin Oxley was the chamber's CEO from 2005 to 2011, when he left the Chamber to head up the UKTI team at the British Embassy in Warsaw. Before Oxley became CEO, day-to-day running of the chamber was the responsibility of Executive Director Barbara Stachowiak-Kowalska MBE (from 1993 to 2005).
Antoni F. Reczek, President of PwC Polska, replaced Alan Jarman as Chairman of the Board in June 2012.
== Recent activities and achievements== The British Polish Chamber of Commerce has been awarded 'best British chamber in continental Europe' for four years in a row (2008, 2007, 2006 and 2005) by COBCOE, the Council of British Chambers of Commerce in Continental Europe. The BPCC was runner-up for this award in 2004 and 2003.
For three years in a row, the BPCC has been awarded the best British chamber for trade development (2014, 2015 and 2016), recognising its preeminent position as a UKTI/DIT Overseas Delivery Partner.
Since August 2014, the BPCC has been an accredited chamber within the British Chambers of Commerce, the second British chamber outside the UK to win accreditation. In April 2015, the BPCC was also accredited by COBCOE.
== External links == * [http://www.bpcc.org.pl British Polish Chamber of Commerce] * [http://cobcoe.org.uk Council of British Chambers of Commerce in Continental Europe (COBCOE)]

'''Camille Maximilien Frédéric, Count de Renesse-Breidbach''' (9 July 1836 in [[Brussels]] – 12 June 1904 in [[Nice]]) was a [[Belgium|Belgian]] [[nobleman]], entrepreneur and author.
De Renesse was born in 1836 at Brussels to an aristocratical family of [[Netherlands|Dutch]] descent. His parents were Maximilien C.J.G.R van Renesse Breidbach and Berthe Walburge Francoise van Gruben. He was a grandson of Clement Wenceslas van Renesse Breidbach (1774-1833), who had sold the ancestral [[Castle of Renesse]] to [[Leonard Pierre Joseph du Bus de Gisignies|Leonard du Bus de Gisignies]].
Camille married Countess [[Malvina de Kerchhove de Deterghem]] on 10 November 1868, daughter of Count [[Charles de Kerchove de Denterghem|Charles-Constant de Kerchhove de Deterghem]] (1819-1882) and Eugénie de Limon (1824-1899). While dwelling in [[St. Moritz]] for recreation Count de Renesse got his vision to establish a giant Monte Carlo-like hotel resort with a grand [[hotel]], baths and golf courses in the [[Engadin]] valley for the European aristocracy. After being rejected in [[Celerina/Schlarigna|Celerina]], [[Sils im Engadin/Segl|Sils]] and finally in St. Moritz due to the Badrutt family's huge power, Count de Renesse succeeded in purchasing some 140 hectares of land in [[Maloja (district)|Maloja]], at the [[Lake of Sils]].
Between 1882 and 1884 he put his vision to reality by letting build the ''Hôtel Kursaal de la Maloja'' (nowadays [[Maloja Palace]]). But since just a few days after the grand opening a [[cholera]] epidemic broke out in nearby [[Italy]], Count de Renesse had to file for [[bankruptcy]] after six months. Furthermore, Countess Marvina died of a so-called "fat heart" in [[Basel]] in the same autumn. Nonetheless the hotel remained a lucrative location for Europe's rich people in the following decades. In 1891, [[Stanford University]] completed Encina Hall, a dormitory inspired by the Hôtel Kursaal de la Maloja's architecture.<ref>[http://histsoc.stanford.edu/pdfST/ST24no1.pdf Encina Hall: Leland Stanford's Grand Hotel] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080624225614/http://histsoc.stanford.edu/pdfST/ST24no1.pdf |date=24 June 2008 }}</ref>
For a long time a rumour has got abroad that Count de Renesse, being drunk, fell off his residence, the Belvedere tower above the hotel, into the [[Bergell]] valley; in fact he moved to Nice where he wrote some Christian books; there he died in 1904.
==Bibliography== * Jesus Christ: His Apostles and Disciples in the Twentieth Century
==See also== * [[Castle of Renesse]]
== External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080611092219/http://www.wanderweb.ch/bergell/renesse.html The Renesse Affair - Article about the Count and the Maloja Palace (in German)]

In [[Civil law (legal system)|civil law]] and [[Scots Law]], a '''commodate''' (''commodatum'') is a gratuitous [[loan]]; a loan, or free concession of anything [[Personal property|moveable]] or immoveable, for a certain timeframe, on condition of restoring again the same individual after a certain time.
It is a kind of loan, or [[contract]], with one difference: the commodate is ''[[wikt:gratis|gratis]]'', and does not transfer the property; the thing must be returned in essence, and without deterioration, so that things which consume by use, or time, cannot be objects of a commodate, but of a loan, because although they may be returned in kind, they cannot in identity.
==References== *{{1728}} *''Webster's Revised Unabridged Dictionary'' (1913)
[[Category:Scots law legal terminology]] [[Category:Legal terminology]] [[Category:Contract law]]

{{Multiple issues|1= {{refimprove|date=September 2017}} {{notability|bio|date=September 2017}} {{advert|date=September 2017}} {{COI|date=September 2017}} }} {{Infobox person | name = David Zeiger | image = David Zeiger.jpg | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1918|02|21}} | birth_place = [[Kovel]], [[Ukraine]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1981|05|10|1918|02|21}} | death_place = [[São Paulo (cidade)|São Paulo]], [[Brazil]] | residence = [[São Paulo (cidade)|São Paulo]] | nationality = [[Brazil|Brazilian]] | occupation = Businessman | spouse = Emilia Zeiger (born Liberman [[Mila Zeiger]]) | children = Sergio Zeiger, Claudio Zeiger, Eduardo Zeiger e Celia Zeiger }}
'''David Zeiger''' (February 21, 1918 - May 10, 1981) Brazilian industrialist in the area of clothing and fashion.
Zeiger's family immigrated from [[Ukraine]] (the part of Ukraine that was then part of [[Poland]]) to [[Brazil]] in the early 1920s. David, with his siblings and mother, met with his father Shaja Zeiger, who had left Poland a year earlier. Shaja Zeiger was a tailor, and in a few years founded Goomtex, a factory for raincoats and overcoats. As a young man, David Zeiger worked with his father, and soon became the manager of the business. After his marriage, David Zeiger began to run Pullsport—a women's fashion factory—along with his wife [[Mila Zeiger|Mila]].
David Zeiger also dedicated his energy to the areas of culture, philanthropy, and publicity.
==Early Years and Education== [[Image:David Zeiger Diploma do clube portugues 1964.jpg|thumb|left]] Zeiger was born in [[Kovel]], Poland, which is now part of [[Ukraine]]. Although raised and educated within the community of Jewish immigrants in the [[São Paulo]] neighborhood of [[Bom Retiro (District of São Paulo)|Bom Retiro]], the adolescent Zeiger already had a good command of Portuguese and a curiosity for Brazilian culture that led him to seek friendships outside the small European community where he lived.
He became a member of the Espéria club, and of the Tietê [[regatta]] club in which he participated as a rower in competitions. He joined the Portugália club, which published a newspaper with texts written by various members. His news stories and fiction began to be published under the guidance of the poet Mario Gallo. Zeiger finished his education at the São Paulo Technical School of Accounting.
==Community Activities== [[Image:David Zeiger Carta de agradecimento do Levi Eshkol 1956-02-21.jpg|thumb|left|190px]] [[Image:David Zeiger Carta de Scylla Medici 1972-01-27.jpg|thumb|right|180px]] After [[World War II]], Zeiger began his philanthropic activities. He helped raise funds and contributed his own resources to the newly created state of [[Israel]].
Most of his efforts were for social causes focused on Brazil. He assisted Carmem Prudente in the establishment of the [[Institute of Cancer of São Paulo|Hospital do Câncer]], and in the charitable campaigns that followed.
[[Image:Diploma de Benemérito - Hospital Albert Einstein.jpg|miniaturadaimagem|180x180px|right]] He was an initial donor of the [[Albert Einstein Hospital|Hospital Israelita Albert Einstein]]. He gave medical access to his employees through the network of SERMA clinics.<ref>http://www.sermasaude.org/rede-credenciada-da-serma.html</ref>
==Citizenship and Politics== [[Image:David Zeiger com Deputado Cunha Bueno.jpg|thumb|right|260px]] [[Image:David Zeiger com Pele.jpg|thumb|left|120px]] Zeiger believed in a Brazil based on the market economy of the United States—with a vast middle class, general access to education and medical services. During the [[Juscelino Kubitschek]] administration (1956 to 1961), he found a favorable climate for this view, which would help Brazil to move out of its agrarian economy to become an industrial giant. At that time Zeiger met congressman Antônio Sílvio Cunha Bueno, with whom he developed a long friendship, and through which he began to participate more actively in the political life of the country. Zeiger promoted Cunha Bueno within the Jewish community. The friendship with the Cunha Bueno family resulted in two homages: David Zeiger Public School, and David Zeiger Street, both in São Paulo.
==Career== [[Image:Marca Pull Sport.jpg|thumb|left|150px]] During the years of the "Economic Miracle" in the 1960s and 1970s, David Zeiger's business expanded quickly. His factory (Cia Pullsport of Malharia) grew to occupy two buildings of seven floors with 500 employees.
In 1967, [[Time Magazine]]<ref>TIME Magazine, ''Brazil's President Costa e Silva'', 1967/04/21</ref> published a cover story with the photo of [[Artur da Costa e Silva|President Costa e Silva]]. The subject was the surge of progress in the economy of Brazil. It quoted examples of leaders in various fields of activity, and presented Zeiger as an example of an industrialist. Zeiger had an unpretentious and communicative character, which he demonstrated equally with both his company employees and important personalities.
==Other interests== [[Image:Telegrama Gilberto Freire 1973-06-11.jpg|thumb|left|270px]] [[Image:David Zeiger Homenagem da Fundação Bienal de São Paulo 1981 Carta Luiz Villares.jpg|thumb|right]] Zeiger participated from the beginning in the textile fairs established by Caio de Alcântara Machado (FENIT), the board of directors of the International Art Biennial of São Paulo<ref>''(In Portuguese)'' XVI Bienal de São Paulo, ''http://issuu.com/bienal/docs/nameafc024'', Homenagem da Fundação Bienal de São Paulo, 16 outubro a 20 de dezembro de 1981</ref> , and sponsored a project aimed at integrating a cultural center with theaters and concert halls in the [[Ibirapuera Park]]. He was also an art collector. In his view, the city of São Paulo had the potential to become the most important metropolis in [[Latin America]].
<!-- —————— End! —————— --> == References == {{Reflist|30em}}
==Links== * ''(In Portuguese)'' Escola Estadual David Zeiger : [https://www.google.com.br/maps/place/David+Zeiger,+Sao+Paulo+-+SP,+Brasil Google Maps] * ''(In Portuguese)'' Rua David Zeiger : [https://www.google.com.br/maps/place/R.+David+Zeiger,+Sao+Paulo+-+SP,+Brasil Google Maps] * ''(In Portuguese)'' Site : [http://sergiozeiger.wix.com/david-zeiger David Zeiger]

{{one source|date=April 2015}} {{Infobox video game |title = DinoPark Tycoon |image = DinoPark Tycoon logo.jpg |developer = [[Manley & Associates]] |publisher = [[Minnesota Educational Computing Consortium|MECC]] |designer = Chuck Bilow |released = 1993 ([[MacOS]], [[MS-DOS]])
1994 ([[3DO Interactive Multiplayer|3DO]]) |genre = [[Business simulation game]] |modes = [[Single player]] |platforms = [[MS-DOS]], [[MacOS]], [[3DO Interactive Multiplayer|3DO]] }} [[File:DinoPark-Tycoon-screenshot.png|thumb|right|alt=A screenshot of the main screen of the DinoPark Tycoon game under MS-DOS.|DinoPark Tycoon main screen (MS-DOS version)]] '''''DinoPark Tycoon''''' is an [[educational game|educational]] [[business simulation game|business simulation]] [[computer game]] released by [[MECC]] in [[1993 in video gaming|1993]] for [[MS-DOS]] and [[MacOS]]. Players run a [[theme park]] which features dinosaurs as its main attraction. The goal of the game is to care for the dinosaurs while keeping the park clean, organized, and well maintained. == Background == ''DinoPark Tycoon'' was developed by [[Manley & Associates|Manley & Associates Inc.]] and published by [[MECC]] (later [[SoftKey]]). Two versions were released: a retail version and a special school version, which was released to public elementary schools across the [[United States]] and [[Canada]]. In addition to the retail software, the school version includes background information and classroom activities for teachers.{{cite web|url=http://www.atarimagazines.com/compute/issue162/90_DinoPark_Tycoon.php |title=DinoPark Tycoon |publisher=Atarimagazines.com |date= |accessdate=2012-10-23}} It was not required by the schools' curricula, but was intended to be a fun way for the students to learn basic finance and management skills.{{Citation needed|date=May 2010}} Writer Larry Blasko of the [[Associated Press]] described the game as having realistic similarities to real-life business management, along with skills such as mathematical estimation and "what if?" analysis.{{cite web |title=Kids can create their own 'Jurassic Park' |author=Blasko, Larry |date=1993-12-18 |page=6 |publisher=[[The Free Lance-Star]] |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=Z14zAAAAIBAJ&sjid=mAcGAAAAIBAJ&pg=3577%2C3837895 |accessdate=2014-03-25}} == Gameplay == The objective in ''DinoPark Tycoon'' is the successful administration of a dinosaur park. Players start off with a $5,000 loan in the retail version, or a $20,000 loan in the school version. The money is used to pay for the land, dinosaurs, fencing, food and employees necessary to run the park and pay back the loan; failure to meet loan payments results in the park's foreclosure. Once the loan is paid off, players may expand the park and earn profits. If players are confused, an animated dinosaur appears and guides the players through the game. Players then visit supply stores to buy the necessary items for park maintenance. The food store provides meat for carnivores, plants for herbivores and seeds for planting. The general store provides fences for the dinosaur pens, with varying degrees of strength and price; concessions such as bathrooms, gift shops and parking lots; and advertising, which is bought per season. The employment office offers the personnel to run the park, and Dino City retails the dinosaurs for the exhibits. As time passes, players face problems such as escaping dinosaurs, sick employees, and seasonal attendance declines. According to [[Atari]], "Keeping the staff paid and the dinos fed and healthy is an ongoing task that requires kids to analyze graphs and numbers and make decisions based on their assumptions. The trick is to scratch out enough profit to expand the park with capital improvements and bigger and better dinosaurs." After paying off the loan, players may choose to sell their park; if it has been successful, the player achieves an onscreen award and an entry on the top scores list. == Ports == ''DinoPark Tycoon'' was released for the [[3DO Interactive Multiplayer]] home video game console in early 1994. It contains minor changes to gameplay and graphics. ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:3DO Interactive Multiplayer games]] [[Category:1993 video games]] [[Category:1994 video games]] [[Category:Children's educational video games]] [[Category:DOS games]] [[Category:Mac OS games]] [[Category:Video games with isometric graphics]] [[Category:Business simulation games]] [[Category:Dinosaurs in video games]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United States]]

revision.text:
{{more citations needed|date=September 2014}} The '''Diplôme d'Ingénieur''' ({{IPA-fr|diplom dɛ̃ʒenjœʁ|lang}}, often abbreviated as ''Dipl. Ing.'') is a postgraduate degree in engineering ''(see [[Engineer's degree|Engineer's Degrees in Europe]])'' awarded by the French [[Grandes Écoles]] in engineering. It is generally obtained after five to seven years of studies after the French [[Baccalauréat]].
Each holder of the diplôme d'ingénieur is also conferred the title of ''Ingénieur diplômé'' (graduate engineer). This is distinguished from the term '''ingénieur''<nowiki/>' (engineer) which is non-regulated and can be loosely used as a generic title based on one's professional position or nature of work rather than formal academic qualifications.
Diplôme d'ingénieur graduates from reputable institutions often access the French job market with a significant advantage compared to PhDs. However, this is not always true for all industries, and roles that require high technical expertise (especially research in specific area) will favor a specialized master's or PhD qualification.
==Accreditation== The title ''Ingénieur diplômé'' is a strictly regulated and protected by the French state. Any institution issuing the diplôme d'ingénieur must be accredited by the [[Commission des titres d'ingénieur]] (within the French Ministry of Higher Education and Research) which is the official administrative body responsible for evaluating higher education institutions to train professional engineers in France. Anyone found to be misusing the title of ''Ingénieur diplômé'' is liable to a €15,000 fine and a one-year sentence in prison.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://legifrance.gouv.fr/affichCodeArticle.do?cidTexte=LEGITEXT000006070719&idArticle=LEGIARTI000021342951&dateTexte=20151002|title=Article 433-17 of the French Penal Code|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|language=French|accessdate=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://legifrance.gouv.fr/affichCodeArticle.do?cidTexte=LEGITEXT000006071191&idArticle=LEGIARTI000006525290&dateTexte=20151002|title=Article L642-12 of the French Educational Code|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|language=French|accessdate=}}</ref>
Since the signing of the [[Bologna Process]] in 1999, the European [[Master's Degree]] is also conferred by the state to the holder of a diplôme d'ingénieur, but the converse is not true. This is because the diplôme d'ingénieur is recognised to include, but significantly surpass, a [[Bologna Process]] [[Master's Degree]].
The diplôme d'ingénieur is also recognized in the United States by the [[AACRAO]] since 2013 as "Master of Science in Engineering".<ref>[https://www.cti-commission.fr/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/mou_aacrao-cti.pdf Memorandum of Understanding (AACRAO - CTI)]</ref>
== Grandes Écoles and Universities in France == France is particular in that only accredited [[Grandes écoles|Grandes Écoles]] in engineering are certified to issue the diplôme d'ingénieur, which is differentiated from bachelor's and master's degrees in engineering issued by public universities (Universités).
Universities in France are comprehensive institutions composed of several faculties covering various fields (natural sciences, engineering, law, economics, medicine, humanities, etc) with a large student body. By law, admission to a French university is non-competitive and open to anyone with a high school diploma. On the other hand, Grandes Écoles in engineering are much smaller in size and recruit their students with very selective processes (typically a few hundred students per year per institution, and a few thousand students per year country-wide), with the minimum qualification being 2 years of post-baccalureate studies in scientific [[Classe préparatoire aux grandes écoles|classes préparatoires]], three to four years University studies (Bachelors or Masters), or an otherwise equivalent training for foreign students, in order to be admitted to the engineer training in one of the Grandes Écoles.
==Curriculum== The engineer training leading to the diplôme d'ingénieur may vary significantly among the Grandes Écoles in terms of curriculum structure, despite the same accreditation from CTI. In general, the most prestigious (therefore highly selective) Grandes Écoles tend to offer a multidisciplinary<nowiki/> curriculum for their flagship engineer program, exposing students to various fields of study with each courses taught at a graduate level. The multidisciplinary engineer program in the so-called 'generalist' Grandes Écoles is usually considered to be more competitive and intensive than specialized master's degree programs. However, this is not always the case, and there are a number of well-established Grandes Écoles that focus on a specialized curriculum for their engineer program.
Student engineers in Grandes Écoles are educated in close cooperation with the various industries through academic-industry partnerships, which introduce graduates to professional life while giving them a solid grounding in their discipline. As many graduates will advance to positions leading future projects and teams, courses related to management and professional training are also included in the curriculum.
In addition to the core curriculum in engineering and science, the French engineer training often includes, and is not limited to: * courses in humanities and social sciences * courses in business administration * visits to production sites * conferences and career talks by professionals * internships and research projects
==Professional training== More than 90 percent of the French engineer programs require at least one internship (typically in a business setting) at some point in the curriculum.
Most schools arrange three types of internships that train the students with progressive responsibilities, initially as observers and increasingly as actors, in order to gain a comprehensive understanding and perspective of all levels of responsibility and roles within the industry. One can distinguish “worker” (blue-collar) internships, “senior technician” internships, and “graduate” internships where the students perform the same type of work they will do as graduate engineers. Internships are graded and constitute part of the academic degree requirements.
==References== {{reflist}}
== See also == * [[Memorandum of understanding]]
{{Academic degrees}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Diplome d'ingenieur}} [[Category:Master's degrees]] [[Category:Education in France]] [[Category:Business qualifications]]

revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{COI|date=March 2016}} {{advert|date=March 2016}} }}
{{Infobox company | name = Forum for International Trade Training (FITT) | logo = Forum_for_International_Trade_Training_(FITT)_Logo.jpg | type = Non-profit | founded = 1992 | founder = Canadian Government and Private Sector | hq_location_city = Ottawa, ON | key_people = Caroline Tompkins, CAE, CITP, President and CEO | industry = Import-export training and certification; international trade training and certification | num_employees = 10 | homepage = http://www.fittfortrade.com/ | location_country = [[Canada]] }} The '''Forum for International Trade Training''' ('''FITT''') is "a not-for-profit organization that offers [[international business]] training, resources and [[professional certification]] to individuals and businesses."<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fittfortrade.com/about-us|title=About Us|website=Forum for International Trade Training (FITT)|access-date=2016-03-07}}</ref>
FITT offers the FITTskills international trade training program, a series of 8 courses for global business professionals can that can be taken either online or in a classroom setting through educational partners.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fittfortrade.com/fittskills-online-courses|title=FITTskills Online Courses|website=Forum for International Trade Training (FITT)|access-date=2016-03-11}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fittfortrade.com/online-instructor-led-courses|title=Online & Instructor-Led Courses|website=Forum for International Trade Training (FITT)|access-date=2016-03-09}}</ref> FITTskills students receive the FITT Certificate in International Trade after completing four of the courses, and the FITT Diploma in International Trade after completing all eight courses.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fittfortrade.com/credentials|title=Credentials|website=Forum for International Trade Training (FITT)|access-date=2016-03-11}}</ref>
The organization also offers the Certified International Trade Professional designation, also trademarked as the FITT International Business Professional designation in the U.S. and Europe.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fittfortrade.com/fibp-details|title=FIBP Details|website=Forum for International Trade Training (FITT)|access-date=2016-03-07}}</ref> It is often referred to as the CITP|FIBP designation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fittfortrade.com/certification|title=Professional International Business Certification CITP {{!}} FIBP|website=Forum for International Trade Training (FITT)|access-date=2016-03-07}}</ref> In French, it is referred to as the Professionnel accrédité en commerce international (PACI|FPAI) designation.
FITT's strategic partners are [[Export Development Canada|Export Development Canada (EDC)]], [[Global Affairs Canada|Global Affairs Canada (GAC)]] and the [[World Trade Centers Association]].
== History == In the late 1980s, Dieter Hollweck, began the planning towards a new organization.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.tradeready.ca/2014/inside-stories/story-began-us-forum-international-trade-training-fitt/|title=The story of how it all began for us, the Forum for International Trade Training (FITT) - Trade Ready|website=Trade Ready|language=en-US|access-date=2016-03-07}}</ref> FITT was then incorporated in 1992 as part of Canada’s sector council initiative.
FITT first launched its FITTskills training program in 1993, which is now in its sixth edition, with the seventh edition being launched in early 2017. In 1996, it also launched the Prior Learning Assessment and Recognition (PLAR) process to allow business professionals to use their previous work and educational experience to earn FITTskills credits. FITTskills courses were first offered online in 1999, which continues today.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fittfortrade.com/about-us/milestones|title=Milestones|website=Forum for International Trade Training (FITT)|access-date=2016-03-07}}</ref>
In 2001, FITT began to accredit [[academic institution]]s and organizations already offering international business courses to offer FITTskills courses. There are currently over 43 educational partners in Canada, China, Colombia, Malaysia, Romania and the UK, offering FITTskills courses in a classroom setting.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://fittfortrade.com/instructorled-courses|title=Instructor Led Courses|website=Forum for International Trade Training (FITT)|access-date=2016-03-07}}</ref>
FITT's CITP designation was first offered in 1998, and the competency requirements were revised in 2006 and again in 2016. Since 2009, it has also been trademarked as the FIBP designation in the U.S. and Europe.
FITT has also awarded honorary CITP|FIBP designations to several notable figures in international trade, including former Canadian Deputy Prime Minister and Finance Minister [[John Manley]], Canadian Chamber of Commerce CEO [[Perrin Beatty]], Governor of the [[Bank of Canada]] [[Stephen Poloz]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://eshaabrol.com/tag/citp-designation/|title=CITP Designation {{!}} Entrepreneur Journal|website=eshaabrol.com|access-date=2016-03-11}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://smith.queensu.ca/emails/poloz.php|title=QBC Ottawa featuring Stephen Poloz|website=smith.queensu.ca|access-date=2016-03-11}}</ref> and former Canadian [[Minister of International Trade (Canada)|Minister of International Trade]] [[Stockwell Day]].{{citation needed|date=March 2016}}
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.fittfortrade.com/ www.FITTforTrade.com] * [http://www.tradeready.ca/ Trade Ready - FITT's international trade blog]
[[Category:Business organizations based in Canada]]
